headline: Morgan Stanley Joins U.S. Bank Exodus from Climate Coalition
summary: U.S. banks, including Morgan Stanley, Citigroup, and Bank of America, are leaving climate coalitions due to mounting pressure from Republican lawmakers and a shift in focus towards regulatory compliance.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley Joins U.S. Bank Exodus from Climate Coalition

headline: Bank of America, Citigroup, Morgan Stanley latest to exit Net-Zero Banking Alliance
summary: The financial institutions’ decision to leave NZBA comes shortly after Goldman Sachs and Wells Fargo announced they were departing the United Nations-backed climate coalition last month.

raw.headline: Bank of America, Citigroup, Morgan Stanley latest to exit Net-Zero Banking Alliance
raw.summary: The financial institutions’ decision to leave NZBA comes shortly after Goldman Sachs and Wells Fargo announced they were departing the United Nations-backed climate coalition last month.

headline: Big Banks Flee Climate Coalition Formed to Reduce Carbon Emissions
summary: Morgan Stanley Citi  group and  Bank of America  this week withdrew from an ambitious pandemic-era climate coalition designed to help drive a shift to reduce carbon emissions by businesses.  JPMorgan Chase  the largest bank in the nation by assets and the only major U.S. bank left in the coalition, is also considering withdrawing from it, a person familiar with the matter said.  A JPMorgan spokeswoman said “the bank regularly evaluates memberships” to ensure they further its “client and business interests.”
